Course Outcomes.CO1: Understand the different components and challenges for Data Lifecycle
Course Outcomes.CO2: Summarize the evolution of Data Research from BI to AI to Hybrid cloud
Course Outcomes.CO3: Summarize the different challenges involved in the management and preparation of data for ML applications
Course Outcomes.CO4: Determine the different methods and best practices to handle data to construct better ML pipelines

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Background: Machine learning background refresher, What is data lifecycle and why is it important?, Why is this important in the industry, Data and Features, Trends on where Data Scientist's time is spent, Importance of Data Prep, Case Study, Data For AI, AI for Data

Data Lifecycle: Overview of different steps, Data Acquisition and associated challenges, Ethical Aspects, PI/SPI identification, Encryption, Metadata, How do data acquisition challenges contribute to upstream uses

Data Exploration and associated challenges: Statistical Inference and exploratory data analysis, Data Variable Types and Identification, Data Exploration using Python, Can all data issues be caught in data exploration?

Data Cleaning/Preparation: Programmatic (Missing Values, Outliers, Data Representations and Challenges, Data Labeling and challenges, Data Bias - can cleaning lead to bias?), Non Programmatic (Data transformations, Normalization)

Data Quality Analysis for ML: Overview of what it means and how it helps a data scientist, Discussion on methods to capture quality issues (Label Noise, Homogeneity, Class Overlap, Advanced class imbalance, Feature Strength), Research Trends
Data Governance: Data Sharing, Access Policy, Regulations like GDPR, Advanced Policy Driven Actions
How it all comes together: Enterprise Case Studies. (May be get an external speaker-Chief Data Officer)
Re looking Data in Hybrid Cloud world: Federated Data, New Challenges in Governance, New Challenges in Discovery, Glimpse of tools in HC - Kubernetes, Istio, OpenSift etc

Resource Material.Textbook: The instructors will provide lecture notes and point to research papers which will be discussed in the class.
